column1: === Sant'Eufemia Lamezia ===
The current Sant'Eufemia Lamezia does not correspond to the ancient city location. The most ancient settlement was the Greek city of Terina
column2: whose ruins were excavated in 1997. Sant'Eufemia Lamezia (nowadays Sant'Eufemia Vetere) was created upon a hill not long after the 1638 earthquake. The current quarter was built in the Fascist era after the drying of a marshy area.

column1: == Transport ==
The central location of Lamezia Terme in Calabria has made it the main transport hub of the region. The city is situated adjacent to the A2 Salerno-Reggio Calabria Motorway
column2: and the state road 288 runs to Catanzaro from Lamezia.

column1: The central railway station
column2: on the main line leading from Reggio to Naples
column3: is a major terminal for goods traffic. Secondary branches connect to Catanzaro and Crotone.

column1: Lamezia is the site of the Lamezia Terme International Airport
column2: built in 1976. The airport has both national and international connections.
